item.title: Oil Markets Remain Cautious Ahead of Fed Decision
item.description: Despite production halts in the Gulf of Mexico and disruptions in Libyan supplies adding to supply-side risks, front-month WTI prices still remain below the key threshold of $70 per barrel, reflecting traders’ cautiousness ahead of the FOMC meeting this week, Phillip Nova said.

item.title: Sterling's Depreciation Potential Might Be Limited in Near Term
item.description: Sterling has tended to weaken after recent BOE meetings, but any depreciation should be limited this time, MUFG said ahead of Thursday’s interest-rate decision.

item.title: Tito Jackson Dies at 70
item.description: The singer with the Jackson 5 topped the charts with hits including “ABC” and “I’ll Be There.”

item.title: Saipem Wins $4 Billion QatarEnergy Contract
item.description: Saipem shares rose sharply after it was awarded an engineering, procurement and construction contract from QatarEnergy LNG.

item.title: ANZ Raises Gold Price Forecast as Fed Prepares to Cut
item.description: ANZ raised its short-term gold price forecast to $2,700/oz and the year-ending 2025 price forecast to $2,900/oz citing the U.S. rate-easing cycle likely to start this month as supporting prices.

item.title: Rexel Rejects $9.6 Billion QXO Bid
item.description: Rexel shares jumped after it rejected an offer from QXO, the U.S. company led by billionaire entrepreneur Brad Jacobs, saying the bid was well below its value.

item.title: Bunds Expected to Stabilize as Fed's Rate Decision Awaited on Wednesday
item.description: German Bunds are likely to stabilize at the start of the week as markets are looking ahead to the Fed’s rate decision on Wednesday, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: China Releases American Pastor After Nearly Two Decades
item.description: David Lin, 68, was one of three U.S. citizens deemed to have been wrongfully detained by Beijing.

item.title: Trump Safe After Another Apparent Assassination Attempt
item.description: The gunman took off in a vehicle and is now in custody.

item.title: Bajaj Housing Finance Shares Surge After India's Biggest IPO This Year
item.description: The mortgage lender’s shares surged on their debut, reaffirming growing investor enthusiasm for one of the best-performing stock markets in the world.

item.title: Suspected Gunman Said He Was Willing to Fight and Die in Ukraine
item.description: Ryan Routh has a lengthy police record and spent years trying to link himself to overseas causes.

item.title: The Crude System of Coded Messages Keeping Hamas's Leader Alive
item.description: Yahya Sinwar’s use low-tech communications has vexed Israel’s efforts to kill him.

item.title: Fed Enters Tricky Terrain: Rate Cuts in a Decent Economy
item.description: Credit cards, mortgages and savings will be affected when the Federal Reserve makes its expected rate cut. The question this time is how, exactly.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
What's News: Business & Finance
The First Shall Be Last (Monday Crossword, September 16)
How Russia Profits From Ukraine Invasion by Selling Stolen Grain on a Global Black Market
item.description: Moscow’s war “is feeding itself” as friends and backers cash in on crops from occupied territories.

item.title: Pepper…and Salt
'Shōgun' and 'The Bear' Dominate the Emmys
item.description: The 17th-century Japanese drama and the chaotic kitchen series broke awards records, but in a surprise, ‘Hacks’ won best comedy.

item.title: More »
item.description: They lived in a pastel-colored home. Mom was in art, dad in IT. Sophie and Daniel had no idea they were actually children of spies.
